00046 int l_serverSock = -1;
00047 int l_clentSock  = -1;
00048 static termios l_saved;            // structure with saved terminal attributes
00049

00051 bool tcpOpen(int portNum) {
00052 
00053     l_serverSock = socket(AF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, IPPROTO_TCP);    // TCP socket
00054     if (l_serverSock == -1){
00055         printf("Server socket cannot be created.\n"
00056                "socket error 0x%08X.",
00057                errno);
00058         return false;
00059     }
00060 
00061     struct sockaddr_in local;
00062     memset(&local, 0, sizeof(local));
00063     local.sin_family = AF_INET;
00064     local.sin_addr.s_addr = INADDR_ANY;
00065     local.sin_port = htons((unsigned short)portNum);
00066 
00067     // bind() associates a local address and port combination with the
00068     // socket just created. This is most useful when the application is a
00069     // server that has a well-known port that clients know about in advance.
00070     if (bind(l_serverSock, (struct sockaddr *)&local, sizeof(local))
00071         == -1)
00072     {
00073         printf("Error by binding server socket.\n"
00074                "socket error 0x%08X.",
00075                errno);
00076         return false;
00077     }
00078 
00079     if (listen(l_serverSock, 1) == -1) {
00080         printf("Server socket listen failed.\n"
00081                "socket error 0x%08X.",
00082                errno);
00083         return false;
00084     }
00085 
00086     // modify the terminal attributes
00087     if (tcgetattr(0, &l_saved) == -1) {  // get the original terminal settings
00088         return false;                             // getting attributes failed
00089     }
00090     struct termios t;
00091     if (tcgetattr(0, &t) == -1) {        // get the modified terminal settings
00092         return false;                             // getting attributes failed
00093     }
00094     t.c_lflag &= ~(ICANON | ECHO);          // disable canonical mode and echo
00095     if (tcsetattr(0, TCSANOW, &t) == -1) {
00096         return false;                              // seting attributes failed
00097     }
00098 
00099     return true;                                                    // success
00100 }

00102 void tcpClose(void) {
00103     tcsetattr(0, TCSANOW, &l_saved);    // restore the saved terminal settings
00104 
00105     if (l_serverSock != -1) {
00106         close(l_serverSock);
00107     }
00108 }

00110 int tcpRead(unsigned char *buf, size_t size) {
00111     int n;
00112 
00113     if (l_clentSock == -1) {      // still waiting for the client?
00114         n = 0;                                      // no data from the client
00115 
00116         fd_set readSet;
00117         FD_ZERO(&readSet);
00118         FD_SET(0, &readSet);                                    // the console
00119         FD_SET(l_serverSock, &readSet);
00120 
00121         struct timeval delay;
00122         delay.tv_sec = 0;
00123         delay.tv_usec = 200000;
00124 
00125         (void)select(l_serverSock + 1, &readSet, 0, 0, &delay);
00126 
00127         if (FD_ISSET(0, &readSet)) { // any intput available from the console?
00128             return -1;                                            // terminate
00129         }
00130         if (FD_ISSET(l_serverSock, &readSet)) {
00131             struct sockaddr_in fromAddr;
00132             socklen_t fromLen = (socklen_t)sizeof(fromAddr);
00133             l_clentSock = accept(l_serverSock,
00134                                  (struct sockaddr *)&fromAddr, &fromLen);
00135             if (l_clentSock == -1) {
00136                 printf("Server socket accept failed.\n"
00137                        "socket error 0x%08X.",
00138                        errno);
00139                 return -1;                                        // terminate
00140             }
00141             printf("Accepted connection from %s, port %d\n",
00142                    inet_ntoa(fromAddr.sin_addr),
00143                    htons(fromAddr.sin_port));
00144         }
00145     }
00146     else {
00147         fd_set readSet;
00148         FD_ZERO(&readSet);
00149         FD_SET(l_clentSock, &readSet);
00150 
00151         (void)select(l_clentSock + 1, &readSet, 0, 0, 0); // wait indefinitely
00152 
00153         if (FD_ISSET(l_clentSock, &readSet)) {
00154             n = recv(l_clentSock, (char *)buf, size, 0);
00155             if (n == -1) {
00156                 printf("Client socket error.\n"
00157                        "socket error 0x%08X.",
00158                        errno);
00159             }
00160             if (n <= 0) {                                // the client hang up
00161                 close(l_clentSock);
00162 
00163                 // go back to waiting for a client, or a keypress to terminate
00164                 l_clentSock = -1;
00165                 return 0;                               // no data from client
00166             }
00167         }
00168         else {
00169             n = 0;                                  // no data from the client
00170         }
00171     }
00172 
00173     return (int)n;
00174 }
